nodes.bodyText: Is this potentially risky? I'm worried there might be colloquialisms etc that show up as typos from the translators.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@
     <issue id="UselessParent" severity="error" />
     <issue id="BinaryOperationInTimber" severity="error" />
     <issue id="RelativeOverlap" severity="error" />
+    <issue id="Typos" severity="error" />

nodes.bodyText: You might be right, if that happen then we can turn this rule off but for now I find it helpful because it will help us fix bugs in new translations.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@

     <issue id="BinaryOperationInTimber" severity="error" />
     <issue id="RelativeOverlap" severity="error" />
+    <issue id="Typos" severity="error" />

nodes.bodyText: Good point. It's really easy to disable if we run into problems.
